website_summaries.verdict: Low price, but it gives you more complex measurements than some other kits.
pros: Gives you option of 40 separate tests
Tests soil for pH, nitrogen, phosphorus, and potash levels
Beginning gardeners can make good use of this kit, thanks to the detailed instructions
Good value compared to many other options
cons: No option to measure water or light levels in soil

customer_reviews.title: FAKE-Picture of test using distilled water
customer_reviews.text: bought to test 5 foodplots/garden areas. 5 tests resulted in N=non detect, P=adequate, K=adequate. tested distilled water. N=non detect, P=adequate, K=depleted. looks cool when you get some colors from the different white powders you pour in. I think that the people that give this 5 stars add lotsa nitrogen and some P&K and get good growth...of course adding fertilizer will improve growth, but the tests are not helpful in optimizing fertilizer rates at all.
customer_reviews.author: Erika B

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't...
customer_reviews.text: This was totally inaccurate. The tests told me (I tested it twice) my yard was depleted of nutrients, however when tested by our local university I found that I was heavily over fertilized. I relied on the test on several occasions and ended up wayyyyyyy over fertlizing my grass.
customer_reviews.author: elmaestro

customer_reviews.title: don't waste money on this stuff if anything send your soil ...
customer_reviews.text: inaccurate follow the directions and used distilled wated. The tests always got readings saying my nitrogen levels are deplated phropaus levels normal and potassium levels normal. Well I took soil samples and send it off they said my n is alittle high my p is excessively high and my potassium is also excessively high. Also even the ph is off it says my soil at 6" after 6 different spots and mix it said it was 6.5 and the college told me it was 7. don't waste money on this stuff if anything send your soil samples off to the colleges in your state with more accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: robert g.

customer_reviews.title: Limited pH range makes virtually useless
customer_reviews.text: I have a naturally alkaline soil, but wanted to do a soil test to see if one area had a particular problem. Unfortunately I found, after trying to use it, that the test kit only goes up to a pH of 7.5 - just half a unit over neutral! All that it really covers are a range of acidic soils. For this reason, I just gave up on the whole kit = totally worthless to me! They should call it a soil test kit for acidic soils.
customer_reviews.author: JohnK

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to handle test material. "40 tests" is a bit deceptive.
customer_reviews.text: The powder used to test is in tiny capsules we're supposed to pull apart and empty into a tube with a tiny opening. Ii suggest it would be better to open it over a small, folded piece of paper,then transfer it to the tube. I don't know how accurate the test are without sending a sample to a lab, but if all the reagent powder test chamber, it might affect accuracy. The "40 tests" claim is strictly correct, but it means only 10 tests of each of the four parameter (pH, phosphorus, potassium and nitrogen), not tests of 40 soil samples. The instructions are pretty straightforward, but hidden inside the folded card that comprises part of the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Watson

customer_reviews.title: I don't trust the results.
customer_reviews.text: The Phosphorus test is supposed to show the results in shades of blue. My result is in a shade of green. Likewise the Nitrogen test is supposed to show in shades of pink. Mine shows in green. I have not mixed up the capsules. None of the test results are blue or pink. Some of the capsule halves are difficult to separate. Watch they don't suddenly erupt sending the powder everywhere. The Ph test seemed to work. The K test showed no Potash in the soil even though I added 3 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. The “results” are extremely unreliable. After doubting the results of the tests I tested a liquid nitrogen fertilizer sample and it showed nitrogen deficiency. The phosphorus reagent was missing so I couldn’t perform that test. The pH test could tell vintages from soda but not much more than that. It seems that quality control on the reagents is hit and miss. I wouldn’t trust it enough to act on the results.
customer_reviews.author: BillG

customer_reviews.title: It measures soil pH and soil nutrients
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it will do; it measures pH, N, P, and K in the soil. This is good. However, it is not exactly rapid as its name implies. It doesn't take days, but it is not immediate either. My biggest problem was that it provides capsules that need to be opened so the contents of the capsules can be added to solutions. I did this with 4 capsules and with 2 of the 4, I found them difficult to open which resulted in some of their contents not being included in the target solution. I assume this resulted in improper concentrations and therefore inaccurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Rater

customer_reviews.title: Package missing 3 of the 4 types of pills
customer_reviews.text: I received this package missing the green, orange, and blue pills. I am still very excited about using this test, which is why I am giving it a 4/5 stars. I tested the nitrogen of my raised garden bed and it showed I was completely depleted. So I then tested the my miracle grow soil and it stated the nitrogen was sufficient! Both were the answers I was expecting. I called customer service at 1-815-337-5560 and they are sending me the pills for the kit. I also asked about the recommendations for replenishing nutrients: for example- nitrogen it lists dried blood (11%), nitrate of soda (16%) with amounts per 100/sqft. This is an EITHER OR, not both (just FYI).
customer_reviews.author: HappyCouple

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great idea in concept, but not so in reality. You have to mix soil with water really well, and let settle. After that you pour into little vials and match colors showing pH, Mg, etc. But the water never really gets clear enough to tell. I tried to sieve it through several different materials but that didn't work. This kit didn't help me one bit. I feel like my money was totally wasted.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: LIke others report, Nitrogen test didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Performed 6 Nitrogen tests to the exact specifications in the instructions, and every time it read a murky clear color meaning Nitrogen completely depleted. The problem is the last 3 tests were done about 2 weeks after fertilizer application where the grass was growing very well and a deep green. There had to be some Nitrogen change in the soil for that to happen, but the tests showed nothing, same murky "depleted" reading.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Storyteller

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use, accurate test so long as you just need a general idea of soil components, as opposed to precise PPM
customer_reviews.text: The results achieved with this inexpensive kit were in complete agreement with much more expensive lab tests on the same soil. Unlike lab results, this test won't quantify your results. It give ballpark calculations for nitrogen, etc., rather than precise PPM. Still, accurate enough to be used on our farm. I plan to use this test for a few years and then have a lab test the soil for a year to see if they are still in agreement.
customer_reviews.author: Forestperson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: We are just getting into gardening and were having problems getting plants to grow. I remembered a friend mentioning about testing the soil so we picked up this kit. Everything was good except the nitrogen which was non-existent. So I picked up a bag of blood meal to add to the garden which will pump up the N. Capsules are a bit of a pain to open, but if you pinch, twist, and SLOWLY pull they will open pretty easily, When reading the results do it outside with sun light or place them in a window to look through them. Overall a decent kit to get you in the ballpark for what your soil needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Prindle

customer_reviews.title: I don’t want to write a bad review but I’m just perplexed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t want to write a bad review but I’m just perplexed... here is my situation.. I live in SC where the soil is mainly clay. I planted tomatoes in a garden that had rich black dirt tilled in. Per the instructions... I dug out dirt 4 inches down... made a 5 to one solution and let it sit for 24 hours. I opened this kit and carefully skimmed off the water on top of the sediment. The water was yellow and cloudy. I did every test as instructed but my solution was so cloudy that I couldn’t get a good reading. The colors didn’t match up at all. What did I do wrong?
customer_reviews.author: MS Travelers Rest

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a bad batch - total failure
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. Testing for nitrogen, I followed directions exactly. Reading comes in "depleated", but I know there's nitrogen as I just mixed the soil and added plenty of blood meal. I ran a test again, doubling blood meal content in my soil, nothing registered.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Ok concept, poor implementation... But fixable if you take extra steps
customer_reviews.text: Use caution as the little plastic containers have a rounded bottom and will fall over easily. Shave off the plastic nib on the bottom left over from the manufacturing process. Instructions are written in typical "english language translation" format... but after a few re-reads I got the intent. Their general instructions can be odd ... "Allow soil to settle in the water (N-P-K test) for up to 24 hours" Why ? Just allow it to settle for 20-30 min and filter through coffee filter. Trust me, cloudy water WILL AFFECT the test results accuracy. Also, Sorry NO... I do not plan to rototill my yard "a minimum of 12" deep" for grass planting. Perhaps they were thinking in metric? IDK
customer_reviews.author: Zylon33

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the capsules...
customer_reviews.text: Biggest trick is opening the capsules without spilling the powder everywhere. One wouldn't even come open...had to carefully cut the end. I think if they could make this part easier, it would be a 5 star product. I also think an instructional video would remove some of the potential confusion with the whole process.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Dent

customer_reviews.title: Good combination of tests especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter to use in an agricultural science fair where we tested 3 different soils with each test. It was fairly easy to use but took some time. The results were for the most part easy to read with only a few were hard to tell, especially the blue ones that had a harder time dissolving. It was definitely a good deal for the price. She won 2nd place in district!
customer_reviews.author: N. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Read the instruction carefully.
customer_reviews.text: It's really very good, but you need to follow the instruction carefully. Read them several times before starting. I've used it to get a baseline on my soil and now I've amended the soil and it was helpful letting me know how bad it was. I just checked after amending the soil and what a difference. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Arenas

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good enough product
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part is getting thru the instructions, which are rather lengthy. When you get that out of the way tho the kit is fairly easy to use. I have one complaint about the sturdiness of the containers. They topple over on a whim because of the rounded base edges. Not sure about accuracy, I have nothing to compare it to. All else aside, it seems to serve its function. One other thing, I'm slightly colorblind, and the violet and blue capsules look nearly indistinguishable. Had to verify with a family member.
customer_reviews.author: Subscriberxyz

customer_reviews.title: How to know?
customer_reviews.text: Used one time and it seemed to work. But the capsules were stuck together at the start and had to cut the tops off to get the powder out. But got results the first time. Now going to test again and 3 out of 4 of the test chambers have no soil fill lines, I used a magnifying glass and still couldn't find them, no way you fill all the way up to the top line, add the powder and then add maybe one drop of water. Disappointing. Find another test kit more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read...
customer_reviews.text: I did not experience the same issues some of the negative reviewers did. Instead, I found the results to be consistent with lab results for our soil. pH varied (as it should) among our beds and garden area. It was easy to use and read; however, I had difficulty breaking open the capsules so I just used some scissors (as recommended as an alternative in the directions.) Good value for the money, and there is a reorder form included for additional capsules.
customer_reviews.author: Register

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The product was consistent with my gardening store testing. The directions were a bit small to read and the capsules provided containing the test chemicals were a bit hard to pull apart without losing some the chemical. It is inexpensive and well packaged with lots of testing material. I would suggest using an old apple corer to take your sample.
customer_reviews.author: John from ALBANY NY

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions very carefully and am happy with the kit overall. The results indicated that our soil is very alkaline, nitrogen depleted, with adequate to sufficient potash and phosphorus. Basically just confirmed what I had suspected in the first place. The only test I question is the phosphorus one. The blue particles fused to the bottom of the plastic container. No matter how hard I shook it (as directed if the particles sink to the bottom), they would not come loose. I couldn't even scrub them out later on.
customer_reviews.author: Kaci

customer_reviews.title: Great kit but can be messy and needs a revision.
customer_reviews.text: Used this kit to test my soil and make adjustments. It's a good investment, but the downside is they give you capsules that they expect you break open and pour into their little containers. Good luck not making a mess! My advice is just break the capsules open onto a folded piece of paper and pour the powder into the container. They should create a new design with better way to dispense the powder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but capsules are inconvenient and sometimes break
customer_reviews.text: For the price I suppose this is a fair product, but the little gel capsules that hold the reagent chemicals are very inconvenient to use and often break or crumble because they are stuck closed after a few months storage. I even store my capsules in a jar with some dessicant but some are still stuck and create a struggle trying to open, eventually breaking apart. I am not sure what better packaging for the reagents is possible, but I wish the Rapitest folks would try because the capsules do not cut it.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Stated, I highly recommend.It will help you understand your soil.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and much quicker results than sending off a soil sample or taking a soil sample in. It's basic chemistry anyone can do. Great value. Out of 20 tests i only had one that was inconclusive and so had to redo. Again this is a great way to test different areas of your lawn or garden to determine issues easily. Many send off labs recommend combining soils to get a general recommendation. I believe this to be better so you can target specific areas. My soil ended up needing a surfactant more than anything.
customer_reviews.author: L. fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Testing your soil is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I used to apply Lime and fertilizer every spring and fall. I used a cheap 10-10-10 fertilizer. It worked OK, but this fall the lawn looked pretty dismal. I decided to try the Rapitest Soil Test Kit. The results showed that I was maxed out on Lime but Nitrogen was completely depleted. I went and bought a high nitrogen fertilizer and skipped the Lime this October. It is now the middle of November and I have a lush, green lawn. I will do the test again in the Spring before I buy any Lime or fertilizer. This really works. I am sold. I will test every Spring and Fall.
customer_reviews.author: B&B

customer_reviews.title: No purple capsules provided for nitrogen test.
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to give it 5 stars But the ph test came back at 6.0 to 6.5. This lot has been Acidic oak trees for 50 yrs in sandy soil. Massey services tested it at 4.5. My much bigger problem is that I Received no PURPLE capsules!!!! I cannot do the nitrogen test! If Luster Leaf is reading this, please send me some. What are the green capsules for??? Blue and orange capsules match the blue and orange comparators and ph had green capsules and comparators Green capsules do not match the purple comparator.
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you set aside enough time for testing.
customer_reviews.text: I took several soil samples from my yard prior to using this testing kit. It takes a while to prepare each sample - make sure you save the instructions as there are specific steps you'll need to go through to prepare each soil test appropriately. Some of the test capsules were difficult to open without spilling powder and you'll also want to clean each plastic container thoroughly between uses (which is tricky as they're the size of a tic tac container). I'm unsure as to the accuracy but it matched the fertilizer plan I'd already planned for the yard. Will update if I learn anything more throughout the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Iffy product! Maybe read other reviews before purchase
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived smashed and looked like someone had already opened. The instructions are complicated and I didn’t really get reliable readings. Feel like this is product is questionable!! The material that make up the plastic capsules could very well alter the PH reading so am a little skeptical. Was more trouble to return so maybe read product reviews before purchase. Mine arrived opened sort of like a returned item from a previous buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Clare raimondo

customer_reviews.title: Take out the guesswork and grow some stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Our new garden wasn't doing so well. I suspected we needed nitrogen, but decided to take the scientific approach. Turn out we needed phosphate as well. The guide shows you how much to add per square foot of existing garden which was super helpful. A couple weeks after adding the supplements in the amounts specified everything took off! Tomato plants in the photo are almost 8' high. We've been eating out of the garden every day for months now.
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It's a gamble.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my package, opened it and found that the green and blue capsules are missing. I can't test my soil Ph or phosphorus without these capsules....so I received a half kit. Called the suggested customer support telephone number and I get a recording that says the number is not a working number. So I guess I'll just leave a review.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl Craig

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough
customer_reviews.text: Not a very accurate test. I compared the results of these tests to a soil analysis by my county extension service and they did not compare well. I think part of the problem was reading the test. It was hard to tell if something was just high or very high. That said, I don’t think the tests are accurate enough themselves to make a good analysis on how to treat your soil.
customer_reviews.author: ECS

customer_reviews.title: I guess you have to test 2 different soiks to see if it's correct.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. After testing old container soil and finding it to be within normal/average range for everything, I wonder about its accuracy. I hate that they make the color ranges so close together. It's really hard to determine which area your tested soil falls in depending on the background lighting. Individual capsules can be a little hard to separate. Just go slow and twist while you're gently pulling them apart. I guess it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: El Dee

customer_reviews.title: Is the product expired or out of date? Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: The orange pills did not come in the pack. Very annoying but I wasn’t particularly upset because I really needed to test the nitrogen in my soil. I did the test three times from different parts of my garden. Each time it came pack completely deficient. I amended the soil. Retested. Same reading. I’m going to try to use coffee as the water and see if I can get a different reading. I think the pills are old or expired.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, OK test results, time consuming to test soil and somewhat difficult to read results but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed OK. I didn't realize you have to mix the soil with water and then let it settle for a few hours before you can test your levels but I guess, how else would you test dirt :) The colors are very close so these are somewhat hard to read but it didn't help that I refused to wait longer for my dirt to settle more which would have made the water clearer. In the end this is too much of a PITA to test dirt for each container but its better than overfertilizing your plants.
customer_reviews.author: iluvdabeer

customer_reviews.title: Test kits leak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to help grow better grass in my front yard. The tops to the test kits leak and do not seal well. This makes it difficult for me to believe the results are accurate. The directions were specific yet confusing. Who knows if my results were actually accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Kylene N Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Easy, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I needed refill capsules but got the whole kit so I could split the capsules with my neighbor. Really good, easy to use. Excellent instructions. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Arpeggio Garden

customer_reviews.title: There Are Better Resources Available
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a scientist and I have no way to verify the accuracy of anything. I only used it once or twice. From what I remember it was a little awkward. The containers are pretty small, which would be okay if you are just testing sand or silt. Regular soil doesn't fit well. The results also seemed way too subjective. After going thru all the steps, in the end I wasn't satisfied that I knew anything more about the soil than before.
customer_reviews.author: Gytaryst

customer_reviews.title: Results appear to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use with clear instructions and what I hope are accurate results. I believe the results, because I had already expected that our sandy soil was very acidic. I also suspected from the condition of the large flower beds that the previous owners had done nothing to amend the soil. I will proceed with adding nitrogen and phosphorus, then check again and gauge the growth of my flowers. Come on Spring!
customer_reviews.author: lolacat

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I've never done a soil test in the past, so I was a bit unsure what I was getting into. We had just dug up 10 large bushes from our back yard, and afters spending some time in the backyard preparing to plant new ones, I decided I should ensure the soil was balanced and ready. The tests themselves are super easy-- each one is color-coded so it's pretty hard to screw it up. The only down side is that it can take a long time for the particles to settle. Overall, I'm super pleased and will continue using these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ashly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to test my soil for food plots where I hunt deer. I can't speak for the accuracy of the tests themselves but based on the test results I got my ph and nitrogen levels were good but I was lacking in phosphorus and potassium. I planted and fertilized based on what I got from the test results and my food plots are flourishing. I thought this was a good kit and fairly easy to use if you've ever been in a high school chemistry lab.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Epps

customer_reviews.title: Multiple samples took awhile to test all
customer_reviews.text: I have never soil tested before. But I had to test 6 areas of our land and it took about 2 hours to do with this kit. I mixed up all soil solution samples for the P, K and N tests and let them settle (at least 30 min) while I did all PH testing in the 6 samples first. Then I had to test all 6 samples P, K and N at at least 10 minutes each. Also, the capsules were a bit of a pain to open.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate N, P, K results.  pH okay
customer_reviews.text: I had soil samples sent to two different labs plus tested the same soil samples with this test kit. The pH results from this test kit were pretty close to the lab results, but the other three tests were not even close. My recommendation is to buy the pH-only test kit if you only want pH results. If you need N, P, K results, don't waste your money on this kit. Spend the $15-20 and send your soil sample to a lab.
customer_reviews.author: Matt1382

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: seems to work as advertised. i have used it 2 times. You have to read the instructions.............. the only issue is, letting the dirt/water settle for a few hours, so it is not so cloudy. One of the batches had to set overnight. no big deal, because i was ready for it to take a while. the second settled in about 2 hours. this is a factor of your dirt, and not the test kit. you have to be able to see through the water for the color to be easy to read. I am happy, saw the kit at garden store, they like it also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stab the caplets!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say how accurate the product is or isn't... without sending out to a lab or running an average, or best 3 of 5, i'm going to take my results at face value since they seem perfectly plausible. I will say that i had a heck of a time trying to wrestle the little caplets open and resorted to cutting the very end with a very sharp knife. kinda more of a *stab* into the caplet, really. but it worked.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Super Value
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about the Luster Leaf Rapitest Soil Test Kit. You get 10 tests for 4 soil conditions. So, if you think something is lacking in a particular area you can test just for that and save the rest of the tests for other areas. Hands down - the best value I have found. BONUS The kit comes with a pH level chart outlining the optimum levels for a variety of plants. Also included are recommendations for soil amendments for N, P, and K. Takes the guess work out of it and the research too. Truly a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: G Buck

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t receive all the tests!
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t receive all of the test strips. We only received half of the strips and they were falling out! Didn’t get to return it in time with not going out as much with Covid19 so I’m stuck only half of what I paid for. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: F4ester

customer_reviews.title: Works great, expensive to reuse
customer_reviews.text: First soil test ever, so maybe they're all involved to read? However, our tomatoes came out beautiful after two failed years of trying, So it certainly worked. My biggest complaint is cost of materials needed to retest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Check your Rapitest Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: I gave 1* because my kit did not contain the 40 capsules to complete any soil testing. I did not check my kit when I first received it; and that was my fault. Come spring time for planting I noticed then that there were no capsules for the testing. I had to order a replacement kit for the capsules and pay for shipping in order to do my soil testing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Nilles

customer_reviews.title: It is certainly better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Using this to hone my lawn care to perfection. It is certainly better than nothing. I was surprised to find out my lawn was low on nitrogen! I actually thought it was going to be high! Turns out I wasn't applying quite enough fertilizer because I was using Milorganite which is an all natural fertilizer. Think of this test kit as giving you a range that your nutrients need to be. You won't get exact results, but it can certainly tell you if your soil is deficient/surprlus in the 3 major nutrients.
customer_reviews.author: SirPaulimusMaximus

customer_reviews.title: Great soil tester
customer_reviews.text: Really good. Easy to use. Just dig up a bit of soil, follow the directions, and in 24 hours you can find out about your soil. I saved my lemon tree that was failing. Found out what it was missing and nursed it back to health.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Sian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit hard to compare the colors specually the orange Potash test. But it gets the job done. It just told me my nitrogen is depleted. Now I can fix an issue before its present on the leaves!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice product with a face-ful explosion of styro-puffy package foam in you face !
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine, but I take away a bit because I had to wash my hands, face, environs, etc after experiencing the in-your-face explosion of styrofoam particles when opening the paper wrapper. What genius thought this one up? Thanks Amazon !!!
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: These are very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal for simple to use testing. You need to clip the end of the capsules with scissors though.
customer_reviews.author: Rodcopter

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well, kit included everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to use, the capsules would be better if they didn't need to be opened but that's a small bit. It takes some timing and patience to follow the directions, which if you do, you will have good results. We were able to determine severe notice deficiency in one of our gardens and the plants are now very happy to have the correct nutrients.
customer_reviews.author: Tad W. Theno

customer_reviews.title: This did the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is good enough for the garden. It helped me adjust the nutrients to optimum levels. When adding nutrients, flood with water and mix soil several times and let rest about a week before testing.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt
customer_reviews.text: What a pain in the butt. The other one that just sticks in the soil gave the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Did

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This test kit is sturdy and easy to use. The only issue I had was the color charts were not made of heavy paper. Since these are made to test soil and you use water, the charts can get wet and may even become unuseable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit for the price. The results are good for a home test kit. I did several control tests which all came out the same. Had my soil tested by local university and results were within range from home kit.
customer_reviews.author: awri

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for new vegetable garden beds!
customer_reviews.text: We started a new vegetable garden in our back yard and really needed to test our soil before purchasing nutrients. This kit worked great! We did a total of 5 rounds of testing at the 4 corners of the bed and 1 from the middle then averaged the numbers out. So far our garden is going great! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Devin R. OlsenTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and simple to use! Make sure to read Instruction first!
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a chance to use this kit and the results was very accurate! My lawn had low nitrogen and potassium! I would say make sure to read the instructions, I was confused at certain point trying to figure out which chamber to fill the test pill in. I never fully understand why fill both test chamber and regular chamber, probably for color purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jian Li

customer_reviews.title: The best I found, but hard to read
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem I had with this was trying to match up the color of the liquid against the colors on the test vials. It helped to go outside where the light was good. The most useful test in the kit for me was the pH test. Distinguishing gradations between two very different colors is easier than distinguishing intensity of a single color that is *almost* the same color as the reference. Despite its limitations, this kit was the best of the ones I purchased. They are all pretty fiddly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeccah

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Product did not come. Only cardboard cover, no test. No way to contact them big tipoff. No not order you can't contact them to fix a problem
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for general use, but I'd go with my local extension office next time.
customer_reviews.text: Test works for the major factors needed. I originally bought this because I was too lazy to dig a few samples and send them to my local extension office. Well, once I opened the kit up, I realized that it would have been easier to ship my dirt to the university and have them go all science on it. Using this kit, especially if you want to test multiple samples (which you should) is a bit tedious. All said, I did a bit more work for less precise results for about the same amount I would have spent sending my samples off.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Fails to detect nitrogen
customer_reviews.text: Having collected 3 samples from various gardens in my yard, and finding that all of them were basically zero nitrogen, even the sample from the greenhouse that's been enriched with lots of aged cow manure, where things grow nicely. I think it is likely the test kit is faulty for nitrogen, at least the one I got was. Update. I got a nitrogen deficient reading on potting soil.
customer_reviews.author: Lee N. Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Soil test kit
customer_reviews.text: My grown son and I are enthusiastic gardeners. We are also technocrats, who would rather apply fertilizer as-needed rather than from ignorance. this test kit at least gives us a chance to know what the local soil deficiencies are, so we don't have to wait for plants' leaves to manifest deficiency with distress symptoms. And without having to send a soil sample away to a distant testing lab.
customer_reviews.author: NoVA guy

customer_reviews.title: After years of guessing, using scientific method for our plants
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use, gives quick results. Now will work on adding nutrients to get our fruit and vegetables to produce. Ordered more test capsules, have a lot of areas to test.
customer_reviews.author: KRBILES

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really tell the story
customer_reviews.text: I questioned the reliability of this product. After adding all the required solid additives to remediate the deficiency I still got the same readings. I would not by this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Shesko

customer_reviews.title: Only measures up to 7.5ph
customer_reviews.text: The panel of comparison colors only goes up to 7.5. So I know my soil is alkaline, but not how alkaline. Wish they had used the back of the color card to continue the colors up to 14. But only 1 to 7.5. No idea how accurate the readings are.
customer_reviews.author: John Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had pine needles falling on the yard and suspected that they were making the soil too acidic for my lawn (which was dying). After careful analysis with this kit, I discovered that the pH was fine, but the whole yard was depleted of nitrogen. Note that you should follow the directions in the package carefully...my soil is mostly clay and the water samples were rather murky, but if you follow the instructions to the letter it is still easy to read the indicators and get a good reading. This involves mixing your soil samples with water and letting the sediment settle for as long as 24 hours (for the P, K, and N tests).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good soil tester. I think it’s accurate and fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kinda hard to read
customer_reviews.text: The color levels are too hard to read. They can be easy to misinterpret in my opinion. It basically told me everything in my soil was average but my lemon trees aren't blossoming so IDK
customer_reviews.author: tbear

customer_reviews.title: My Soil's PH was off! Who Knew it affected my tomatoes!
customer_reviews.text: The past two summers, my raised vegetable gardens have been producing fewer tomatoes. Someone told me to check the PH level of the soil. Woah! My PH was off for the vegetables I was growing. I will add nutrients to my soil and check back in the spring. I'll edit this review when my tomato plants come in.!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kit
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive kit, reasonably priced. Accuracy? Don't know because I have no control mechanism to check it with. Can only use each test ten times, then have to order more test capsules, about 20 bucks on Amazon. Cheaper to buy another complete test kit.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Rapidtest is very helpful
customer_reviews.text: My yard is mostly clay, but i have been working to improve it for years. I was unsure of the nitrogen, potash, and ph levels in different areas so i got the kit. I pulled out 8 samples from various areas and tested them, then was able to treat the area for its needs. I live on a lake, and i had always heard that i did not need to use fertilizer because i irrigate with lake water and it is full of farm fertilizer run off. I decided to test the lake water, and found that the stories were false. This test allows me to properly fertilize and augment the soil.
customer_reviews.author: CS in Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Helpful to know how to amend soil
customer_reviews.text: The tests require letting the soil/water mixture sit overnight for certain tests. It's worth it as I was surprised how nutrient deficient certain parts of my garden were. Very helpful to know so soil can be amended with proper minerals.
customer_reviews.author: plm

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, But
customer_reviews.text: Tested and had the test checked by my Garden Center, they matched, Great it did the job, BUT The container to test with is awkward to use and even more awkward to clean and dry Suggest using some other container to do he testing then pour your results into their container to check the test
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: They never shipped a complete product, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the first kit, arrived on time, but only contained the green cardboard paper and the white pamphlet of directions, neither were in original packaging, just tossed in a bag, no testers, cotrainers, etc. Received our "replacement" today and it didn't come with the pills it was supposed to so we could mix with water and actually test the soil. Were giving up here, not worth the hassle of returning when we will most likely receive a part of our order again.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nitrogen capsules do not return results.
customer_reviews.text: I have used 4 nitrogen tests, all resulting in no traces. I finally added a drop of liquid nitrogen 30-0-0 to the test kit and still zero results. I have contacted seller and will update review if/when I get a response.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Silver

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Waste of your time and money. Color is not possible to see in most of my tests. Just send your soil off for the $4-6 to your local university for testing.
customer_reviews.author: William D

customer_reviews.title: Appears inaccurate with N and Potash, capsules are problematic and tops don't match for two containers.
customer_reviews.text: Few comments. 1) Similar to other postings, the N and Potash seem unreliable. Showing completely depleted which isn't the case. Potassium pretty much isn't a concern for most folks so with these two highly variable/inaccurate, only thing left is PH. 2)The tops aren't matching with the containers for 2 of them..offshade and unless you keep straight can readily intermix them. 3)Also as mentioned in other posts, capsules are a pain...Should consider maybe small packets.
customer_reviews.author: M Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I trust it..
customer_reviews.text: It provides reasonable results on the pH (that's easy), potentially on the potassium and phosphorus, but I don't trust the nitrogen reading at all. I put recently-fertilized soil in and it showed zero nitrogen. I put straight fertilizer in, still zero nitrogen. Probably better to dig up a soil sample and send it off to your local county extension type joint for a legit analysis if you're going to base much off of the results. Or do that in one location where you also take a sample with this, and if it matches then continue on with this. If not, chuck it and write a review!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Only tried to test ph so far. All I have is a dirt brown color. No test color at all is visible. I will go back to paying for samples to be read by local college. Waste of money, don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I tested multiple potted plants (different in age) and each one was different. I can only guess if the accuracy is right but gave me an idea of how much I needed to alter my 2yr old jalapeno plant and new blueberry.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Not sure of accuracy of results
customer_reviews.text: After performing test, it showed deficient for nitrogen, which I find a questionable result as the soil tested has a lot of animal manure/hay ( composted) added and has for years, which is a good source of nitrogen. So now I am not sure the other results are accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Our company manufactures soils. We didn't expect these tests to be spot on, but wanted to use them to see when our stock piles were close to being ready for testing by an independent lab. The results we received were all over the chart and completely inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Our side hill has not had very good luck with growth and I wanted to plant an herb garden. This kit lead me to add nitrogen. I have been putting coffee grounds and will add some pea plants to help boost the nitrogen. I don’t need it to be 100% accurate so I felt like this helped me to understand what nutrients may be missing! Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is so suspect, you are better off just flipping a coin.
customer_reviews.text: The Ph and Potash tests seem to work. The Nitrogen and Phosphorous don't register at all. I got a bit suspicious when I tested 3 different areas and all showed zero Nitrogen and zero Phosphorous and high Potash. Even an area I had professionally tested 9 months ago which registered very high Phosphorous registered zero. To verify, I dumped some fertilizer in water and tested that. Again, zero Nitrogen, zero phosphorous. So either I got a bad batch or it just plain doesn't work. Too bad, I had high hopes as soil tests cost around $75.
customer_reviews.author: Jerel Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Short Shelf life
customer_reviews.text: I did not see a product shelf life. I bought this product about 8 months ago and the pill packets are already no good. I only used the product once before. It was stored in a dry place.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana S.

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Garden
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have worked great. Easy to use. I'm glad I went this route as opposed to sending samples out for testing. And I'll probably be able to use this again and again in the future. So the quality and value are good. Separately, having tested my soil and making improvements accordingly (lots of bone meal, in my case), my large garden has finally stopped killing everything I planted. So I earnestly encourage you to give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: saha6818

customer_reviews.title: Some of the capsules were empty, but the remaining worked ok.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive my soil testers but have been disappointed, not in the product itself- it works fine but several of the capsules were empty. I still have some yet to use so I don't know how many of those are empty. i guess it is a manufacturing problem. The ones that wete full and I was able to use worked good. Just sad to pay for something and not get it all...
customer_reviews.author: grandma1245!

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I tested this against an old meter and at least one element, pH is not accurate. Basically it's hard to use, to distinguish colors, i.e. levels. This kit is not of value to me. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ZED

customer_reviews.title: Took a star off because the capsule are a total ...
customer_reviews.text: Took a star off because the capsule are a total pain to pull apart. i had to use scissors and of course when i did that the powder got everywhere. I almost gave this 3 stars but i'm giving 4 because it seems to give an accurate reading,
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I put down sod this spring and wanted to quickly test my soil. This product is simple to use and quickly informed me that my soil was completed depleted of Nitrogen and Potassium, which helped me choose the right fertilizer. I took one star off because it can be hard to decifer between the colors.
customer_reviews.author: ATL Mom

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase, was able to easily tell what nutrients ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase, was able to easily tell what nutrients my soil was lacking without being hustled for money. The results were unexpected. Once I made the adjustments to my fertilization mix my bermuda grass had no more bare spots and was as green as a professional baseball stadium.
customer_reviews.author: Cody R. Lusnia

customer_reviews.title: Missing Nitrogen Capsules
customer_reviews.text: My test kit arrived with missing pieces. The number listed to contact is for "Standard Plumbing", according to my phone's caller I'd, and is out of order. Since Luster Leaf is in IL, they are closed due to COVID19. I'll try again, but wanted to record that I am missing the purple capsules for the Nitrogen tests.
customer_reviews.author: This Pebble Rocks!

customer_reviews.title: Capsules don't come apart!
customer_reviews.text: The kit is typical of others in that there are 4 total tests. None of this matters if you cannot open the included test chemical capsules that you must open. These capsules are brittle and stuck together, rendering the kit useless.
customer_reviews.author: SpecialK

customer_reviews.title: Great for larger garden areas
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product. I do wish I had something quicker. you have to take the soil and put it in a tube with water. you let the soil settle to the bottom then you take a dropper and get the water off of the top and put it in a plastic cup. after you put it in a plastic cup you put one of the associated pills in it and it changes color. It just seemed like a lot when I have several small types of planters to check.
customer_reviews.author: Flowerchild

product_meta.title: Luster Leaf 1601 Rapitest Test Kit for Soil pH, Nitrogen, Phosphorous and Potash, 1 Pack
product_meta.description: Size:1 packIt’s vital to know the existing pH, Nitrogen (N), Phosphorous (P) and Potash (K) levels in garden soil. The rapitest Soil Test Kit continues to be the standard for home soil testing. The kit includes all components needed to for (40) tests: (10) each for pH, Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Potash. The patented color comparator system allows for easy color comparisons versus a typical printed color chart. Extensive, yet simple, instructions are included along with recommendations for over 400 plants. Test results allow the gardener the amend and fertilize appropriately, ensuring the best possible results
feature_bullets: Quick, at home results for Soil pH, Nitrogen, Phosphrous and Potash
Innovative and inexpensive soil test kit features an easy-to-use capsule system and patented color comparators
Soil pH preference list for over 450 plants included
Contains all components needed for 40 tests. 10 for each of pH, N, P and K
Simple, detailed instructions included. Great for beginners and experienced gardeners alike.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,028 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
